alert.note: Alert for Columbia (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 12 at 6:32PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Pennsylvania, including the following counties, Columbia and Schuylkill. * WHEN...Until 930 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 631 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain has fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Bloomsburg, Pottsville, Berwick, Tamaqua, Schuylkill Haven, Shenandoah, Minersville, Mahanoy City, Frackville, St. Clair, Ashland, Orwigsburg, Valley View, Mcadoo, Pine Grove, Port Carbon, Tremont, Girardville, Hometown and Tower City. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
